[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/src/natives/cryptography/helpers.rs] [Function: log2_floor()] [Transaction Replay] If gas calculations are non-deterministic due to log2_floor variations, could a transaction be accepted on one chain fork but rejected on another, causing consensus confusion? [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/src/natives/cryptography/helpers.rs] [Function: log2_ceil()] [Match Performance] The match statement has 3 arms (0, 1, _). Is the match compiled efficiently, or could it introduce overhead in hot paths like MSM window calculation? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/src/natives/cryptography/helpers.rs] [Function: log2_ceil()] [Recursive Call] log2_ceil calls log2_floor, which is another function call. Could this double function call overhead affect performance in hot cryptographic loops? (Low)
